intro: Arundarbor cornuta, commonly known as the horned orchid, is a striking member of the orchid family (Orchidaceae) native to the temperate forests of southern Africa. It is characterized by its unique, elongated floral structure that resembles a horn, giving it its common name. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, with slender, upright stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers, which bloom in late summer, are usually pale purple or white with a distinctive, spurred petal. Arundarbor cornuta thrives in well-drained soil and partial shade, making it a popular choice for shady garden environments.
